alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 11:40PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Snow and Sleet showers will cause adverse driving conditions... A line of convective cells are producing sleet and snow showers across western Elko, northern Lander, and northern Eureka counties. These cells are moving SE at 25 MPH and will approach the I-80 corridor by midnight. Areas from Carlin, Elko/Spring Creek, north to Ryndon will see periods heavy sleet/snow mix through 2 AM PST, that may drop visibilities to below one mile, and create locally slick driving conditions. Motorists should use extreme caution if approaching these showers, as road conditions will rapidly become hazardous, along with decreased visibility and erratic crosswinds. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.

area.areaDesc: Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County
